text.body:
<div1 type="document" xml:lang= "fr"
celui ci sa lettre lui Morton du 5 8 1882
Paris, le 28 8 1882
Là l'arrival des [?] , la ministre des Etats Unis me fait savoir que les bâtiments á la maison [unreadable-3 words] de "Ningué Island" auraient étè [unreadable] dans le [unreadable] Je vois [unreadable] servir par les [crossed out] [unreadable] indigénes [crossed out] ainsi que vous les eues par la [unreadable] á [unreadable] dont [unreadable] en jointe, le supérieur de beta mission, Rev Walker, qui [unreadable], a djá fait l'objet d 'une communication de votre département en data du 10 mars [crossed out] [unreadable] [unreadable] l'incursion outil a étè victoire [crossed out] serait la [unreadable] de l'expedition faits [unreadable] de á tes amis par le "Marabout" [unreadable] du Gabon et il [unreadable] [unreadable] ca [unreadable] au q'françai[?] une [unreadable] de 3500 frs
Je vous servi obligé de vouloir bien [unreadable] cette affaire & de me faire connaitre la suite qu'il [crossed out-3 words] la réclamation [unreadable] Walker [unreadable] [crossed out] aura par á conforter.
teaa.fr.letter.363.002.jpg
Dans [unreadable] local du 10 Novembre 1864
Je vous priè de donner [unreadable] de ces diputations[?], que je m [unreadable] entièrement, à Mr. le Ministre des Etats Unis à Paris, et de lui demander l'inviter Mr. Walker à fournir à l'appui de sa réclamation les gentrifications nécessaires
Je vous priè de donner [unreadable] de ces diputations[?], que je m [unreadable] entièrement, à Mr. le Ministre des Etats Unis à Paris, et de lui demander l'inviter Mr. Walker à fournir à l'appui de sa réclamation les gentrifications nécessaires
Je vous serai obligé de me renvoyer la note C'a jointe dès que'elle aura cette ' de vous être utile.
Agréez, Monsieur le President du Conseil et Cher Collégue, les assurances de ma haute considération.
Le Ministre de la Marine et des Colonies,
[signature unreadable]
One of his letters from Morton August 5th, 1882
Paris, August 28, 1882
There, the arrival of [unreadable], the United States Ministry already told me that the buildings of the house [unreadable] of Ningué Island were [unreadable] in the [unreadable] I see [unreadable] to serve by the [crossed out] [unreadable] indigenous [crossed out] that you had them by the [unreadable] by the to [unreadable] whose [unreadable] were joined, the superior beta missiont, Reverend Walker, who [unreadable], already had communicated to your deparment with the data of March 10th [crossed out] [unreadable] [unreadable] the incursion was the tool of victory that will be the [unreadable] of the expediction facts [rest unreadable] from your friends by the "Marabout" [unreadable from beginning] from Gabon and it [unable to translate] [unable to translate] 3,500 francs
I am obliged to serve you well [unreadable] in this affair and to know the following from me [unable to translate] the complaint [unable to translate rest] Walker [crossed out] will have conforted
In [unreadable] around November 10, 1864
I am pleased to give you [unreadable] of these [unreadable] i [unreadable] entirely to Mr. the United States Minister to Paris et ask him to invite Mr. Walker to give support to the his complaint of the necessary gentrifications
I will be obliged to resend the note that was joined in whcih it will have be of use to you.
Agree, Mr. Council President and dear Colleague, the assurances of my utmost consideration.
The Ministry of the Navy and of the Colonies
[unreadable]
